org.xmlcml.euclid
Class Point3

java.lang.Object
  org.xmlcml.euclid.Point3
All Implemented Interfaces:
EuclidConstants
public class Point3
extends java.lang.Object
implements EuclidConstants

3-dimensional point class Point3 represents a 3-dimensional point. It is one of a set of primitives which can be combined to create and manipulate complex 3-dimensional objects. Points can be transformed with rotation matrices or rotation-translation matrices (Transform3), can be calculated from other primitives or can be used to generate other primitives. Default point is 0.0, 0.0, 0.0

Author:
Peter Murray-Rust, (C) P. Murray-Rust, 1996
See Also:
Vector3, Line3, Point3Vector, Plane3

Field Detail

CRYSTALFRACTEPSILON

public static final double CRYSTALFRACTEPSILON
tolerance between crystal fractional coordinates. allows for 1/3 being represented as 0.3333 which will not fit normal equality

See Also:

equalsCrystallographically

public boolean equalsCrystallographically(Point3 p)
are two crystallographic points identical. shifts x, y, z by +-1.0 if necessary compares content of crystallographically normalised points with Real.isEqual()

Parameters:
p - point to compare
Returns:
equal if coordinates are equal within CRYSTALFRACTEPSILON

normaliseCrystallographically

public Point3 normaliseCrystallographically()
normalise crystallographically. shifts x, y, z so that values lie between 0.0 (inclusive) and 0.1 (exclusive) modifies this

Returns:
modified point

calculateFromInternalCoordinates

public static Point3 calculateFromInternalCoordinates(Point3 p1,
                                                      Point3 p2,
                                                      Point3 p3,
                                                      double length,
                                                      Angle angle,
                                                      Angle torsion)
                                               throws EuclidException
add point using internal coordinates. used for z-matrix like building p1-p2-p3-newPoint

Parameters:
p1 - existing point
p2 - existing point
p3 - existing point
length - p3-p4
angle - p2-p3-p4
torsion - this-p2-p3-p4
Returns:
new point; null if two points are coincident or three points are colinear
Throws:
EuclidException - two points are coincident or 3 colinear
